intro: Stypandra latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf stypandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are broad and ovate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, which are typically found in the axils of the leaves. Stypandra latifolia is often found in sandy soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. It is an important component of the local flora and is sometimes used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
